Name: market for sodium formate | sodium formate | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19157/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'sodium formate', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;sodium formate'  is an organic substance with a CAS no. : 000141-53-7. It is called 'sodium;formate' under IUPAC naming and its molecular formula is: CHNaO2. It is solid under normal conditions of temperature and pressure, it appears as colourless to white crystals. It is soluble in water, glycerol, alcohol and formic acid. It is modelled as a pure substance. On a consumer level, is used in the following products: washing & cleaning products, polishes and waxes and water treatment chemicals.  There is no publicly available information about the consumption of this substance on industrial sites.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'sodium formate',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'sodium formate',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
